Welcome to Maze Operations page!¶

Here is all the necessary documentation for the project:¶

A*:¶

Use A* to find the optimal route through a maze.

class modules.maze_operations.a_star_search.AStarSearcher(maze)¶

Detect an optimal path in a maze.

search_path() → Optional[set]¶

Search for the path using A*.

Maze:¶

Represent a maze.

class modules.maze_operations.maze_adt.Maze(name: Optional[str] = None, size: tuple = 0, 0, array: Optional[list] = None, **kwargs)¶

Represent a maze.

find_q_data()¶

Train a QAgent to solve the maze and gather desired information.

classmethod from_api(name: str, dimensions: tuple = 10, 10, algo: str = 'Recursive Backtracker', solution_len: Optional[int] = None, maze_id=None)¶

Get a single maze with the given parameters from the API.

Parameters

  • dimensions – dimensions of the graph

  • algo – algorithm of the graph

  • solution_len – length of the solution

  • maze_id – an id of a specific generated maze

:return:a Maze() instance from API :exception MazeConstructionError: change dimensions or solution length

classmethod read_from_database(path: str) → modules.maze_operations.maze_adt.Maze¶

Get a maze from the database.

Parameters

path – path to the maze directory

Returns

a maze object with appropriate parameters

save_to_database() → dict¶

Save the maze to the database.

Returns

a representative dictionary for sorting database

exception modules.maze_operations.maze_adt.MazeConstructionError(dimens: tuple, solution_len: int)¶

An exception for rare conflicting parameters.

exception modules.maze_operations.maze_adt.MazeNameError¶

Exception for invalid maze name.

exception modules.maze_operations.maze_adt.MazeUnsolvableError¶

Indicates that maze cannot be solved.

Maze List:¶

Work with a maze list for representing all sortable mazes.

class modules.maze_operations.maze_list.MazesList(options_filename: str = 'static/database/options.json', list_filename: str = 'static/database/mazes_list.json')¶

Represent a collection of all sortable mazes.

get_context() → dict¶

Get context for web page.

property names¶

Get all mazes’ names.

save()¶

Save mazes to database.

sort_by_key(filters: dict) → Collection¶

Sort filtered mazes by key.

Parameters

filters – key and filters

Returns

a sorted collection

Process Maze:¶

Work with a background processor thread.

class modules.maze_operations.process_maze.BackgroundProcessor(queue: modules.helper_collections.llistqueue.Queue, maze_list: modules.maze_operations.maze_list.MazesList, l_rates: tuple = 0.1, 0.3, discounts: tuple = 0.95, 0.75)¶

A thread for handling maze processing.

process_maze(maze: modules.maze_operations.maze_adt.Maze)¶

Process a maze: use A* and Q Learning techniques.

run()¶

Run the thread while the main program runs.

exception modules.maze_operations.process_maze.MazeNameExists¶

Indicates that maze with this name already exists.

Q Learner:¶

Work with the Q Learning processing.

class modules.maze_operations.q_learner.QAgent(x: int, y: int)¶

Agent in the enviroment.

action(choice: int)¶

Move the agent according to choice.

move(x: int = None, y: int = None)¶

Move the agent by (x, y) or randomly if no value is given.

property position¶

Get the agent’s position.

class modules.maze_operations.q_learner.QLearner(maze, epsilon: float = 1.0, episodes: int = 10000, show_episodes: int = 500)¶

Represent the enviroment for QLearning.

choose_action(obs: tuple) → Union[int, numpy.ndarray]¶

Choose the action for q agent (randomly or optimally).

Parameters

obs – current state

Returns

the action (int 0-3)

draw_maze(route: Collection, reward: int = None, new_obs: tuple = None, verbose: bool = False) → <module ‘PIL.Image’ from ‘C:\Users\osobkovych\AppData\Roaming\Python\Python37\site-packages\PIL\Image.py’>¶

Draw the maze and return the image.

Parameters

  • route – route to include

  • reward – reward to indicate completion

  • new_obs – new observation (next state)

  • verbose – whether to display the image

Returns

the image object

get_reward(player: modules.maze_operations.q_learner.QAgent, obs: tuple) → int¶

Get the reward for moving.

Parameters

  • player – current agent

  • obs – current observation (agent position)

Returns

the reward depending on action

train_env(learning_rate: float = 0.1, discount: float = 0.95, verbose: bool = False) → dict¶

Train the whole enviroment while not solved.

When solved optimizes route for some iterations. :param learning_rate: learning rate :param discount: discount rate :param verbose: whether to display additional info :return: valuable analysis information

train_single_episode(episode: int, episode_rewards: list, learning_rate: float, discount: float, verbose: bool, track: bool = False) → Union[Collection, bool]¶

Train a single episode.

Parameters

  • episode – number of episode (from 0)

  • episode_rewards – list of all episode rewards

  • learning_rate – learning rate

  • discount – discount rate

  • verbose – whether to display additional information

  • track – whether to track all episodes’ routes and rewards

Returns

if track return route, if solved return False, else True
